intro: Pelargonium × clausum, commonly known as the African marigold, is a hybrid shrub native to South Africa. It features bright yellow to orange flowers with a strong, spicy fragrance, which is characteristic of the pelargonium genus. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is often used in both horticultural and medicinal applications.
